description.narrative: The most significant, expected Project-level effect is increased access to climate finance and SMEs. Beyond the Project-level impacts, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote competitiveness of climate financing market by enabling Santander, a large private sector bank, to grow its business in this space, which demonstrates to the market a replicable solution and encourages private sector FIs to invest in climate-related business and to expand lending to SMEs.

The proposed investment (the Project) is a 50-50% unfunded risk sharing facility with Banco Santander Chile (Santander or the Bank) on a portfolio of trade-related assets for up to US$300 million and an availability period of 3 years. As part of the Project, Santander Chile will retain at least 50% of the total portfolio exposure, while IFC will take the risk of the remaining 50% or up to US$150 million. The Project will provide Santander with a risk mitigation tool which will allow the Bank to preserve capital for a portion of its trade-related assets. The total capital conserved per annum will be redeployed to generate up to US$150 million to finance climate-related and small and medium enterprises (SMEs) portfolio.
